Seven essentials with which a king’s fro: A moat that is deep and wide
A patrol path that is high and wide
Stores of many weapons, both projectile and hand-held
A gatekeeper who is astute, competent, and intelligent
A wall that’s high and wide, covered with plaster
Four kinds of sustenance a king’s fronti: Much hay, wood, and water stored up
Much rice and barley stored up
Much food such as sesame, green gram, and black gram stored up
Much medicine— ghee, butter, oil, honey, molasses, and salt—stored up
Seven good qualities that a noble discip: Faith in the Realized One’s awakening
Wisdom of arising and passing away
